definition: tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
7th earthly branch: 11 a.m.-1 p.m., noon, 5th solar month (6th June-6th July), year of the Horse/ancient Chinese compass point: 180° (south)
enough blood flowing to float pestles (idiom); rivers of blood/blood bath
see 磨杵成針|磨杵成针[mo2 chu3 cheng2 zhen1]

If you work at it hard enough, you can grind an iron bar into a needle./cf idiom 磨杵成針|磨杵成针, to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently
pinyin: zhi3 yao4 gong1 fu5 shen1 , tie3 chu3 mo2 cheng2 zhen1
containing_words.word: 只要功夫深，鐵杵磨成針

definition: to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently

sentences.english: Dry fry the cumin and coriander seeds, then grind them into a powder using a pestle and mortar.
sentences.chinese: 幹炒孜然和芫荽籽，然後用杵和臼磨成碎末。

sentences.english: In every tower stands an archer with a bow in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 每座塔上均杵着一名手握弓箭的射手。

sentences.english: He ground the rock candy with a mortar and pestle .
sentences.chinese: 他自己動手用研鉢和杵把冰糖研成粉。

sentences.english: She was pounding it in a mortar with a pestle, to separate the husks.
sentences.chinese: 她把稻米放入臼鉢裏，用杵搗着，以分離稻殼。

sentences.english: After artificial ink-sticks appeared in Han, pestle gradually disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 在漢代出現了人工墨之後，杵逐漸消失。

sentences.english: You can use your fingers to crumble the herbs into small pieces or use a mortar and pestle.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用手指將藥草弄碎成小塊或是用研鉢和杵。

sentences.english: Then when he turned around his elbow smacked into my nose causing it to break.
sentences.chinese: 然後他回頭的時候肘子杵斷了我的鼻子。

sentences.english: A mortar and pestle was first used to pulverize the granules of Ignition Powder .
sentences.chinese: 迫擊炮和杵首次用來粉碎的顆粒點火粉末。

sentences.english: Only know how to hold pestle autumn anvil, high-rise buildings no longer feel dated.
sentences.chinese: 只知抱杵搗秋砧，不覺高樓已無月。

sentences.english: He straight goes away and leaves Wang Shifa in the front of manure alone.
sentences.chinese: 說完徑直離去，把王世厚杵在糞堆前。

sentences.english: With a precooled device, grind the embryos to a fine powder.
sentences.chinese: 用預冷的杵磨將胚胎搗碎成粉末。

sentences.english: What drink requires the use of a "bar muddler" in its preparation?
sentences.chinese: 什麼樣的雞尾酒在製作過程中需要使用搗杵？

sentences.english: This glass is ground under water using pestle and mortar.
sentences.chinese: 玻璃在水下被杵和臼碾壓。

sentences.english: I don't know how you say in English and we use a mortar and a pounding stick.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道用英語怎麼說，我們用臼和杵把它搗碎。

sentences.english: My mother did those fingers my way again.
sentences.chinese: 母親又把指頭杵在了我眼前。

definition: to not move a single jot (idiom)
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
